decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (15.65.02, 15.65.03, 15.65.05, 15.65.06, 15.65.08, Flood Risk Assessment December 2015. Received: 10/02/2016. SITE PLAN. Received: 25/04/2016. 15.65.04 Rev. A, 15.65.07. Rev. A. Received: 16/05/2016. Assessment of Ecological Impacts 19/05/2016. Received: 20/05/2016) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - The premises shall be used for B1 (excluding B1(a)), B2 and B8 and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class B of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).
Condition : 5 - No fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - No machinery shall be operated, no process shall be carried out and no deliveries taken at or despatched from the site outside the following times [08:00 - 18:00] nor at any time on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.

Condition : 7 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 08:00 to 18:00 on Mondays to Friday and 09:00 to 13:00 on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and public holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 8 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the rear wall of the extension hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 9 - Prior to the first use of the hereby approved extension, an Emergency Flood Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall use up-to-date information on flood levels to inform the strategy. The Plan shall include, but may not be limited to:
a.	Details for safe refuge arrangements for future staff
b.	Details of safe access/egress routes prior to an extreme flood event for future staff
The Emergency Flood Plan shall be implemented throughout the lifetime of the hereby approved development.

Condition : 10 - No development shall take place until an Ecological Enhancement Plan is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Ecological Enhancement Plan shall include, but may not be limited to:
"	Provision of climbing plants to the rear and sides of the new building.
"	Provision of bat and bird boxes.
The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.
description: Erection of a single storey extension to provide additional employment space (Use Class B1/B2/B8)
